params.text:
Welcome to the four-week Mindfulness course

University life can be exciting, but it can also be stressful and overwhelming. This self-paced online course is designed to introduce you to mindfulness, a simple yet powerful way to manage stress, improve focus, and cultivate a greater sense of well-being.

 

How this course works

Self-paced: Complete one session per week at your own convenience. Each session includes videos, guided mindfulness exercises, and reflection prompts to help you integrate mindfulness into your daily life.

Home Practice: To get the most out of this course, you’re encouraged to practice mindfulness in small, manageable ways each day. Some practices will be formal (guided meditations), while others will be informal (bringing mindfulness to everyday activities). Try it out and see what works for you.

 

This course isn’t about doing mindfulness perfectly, it’s about exploring what works for you. Whether you continue with mindfulness beyond these four weeks or just take a few helpful tools from it, this experience is yours to shape.

params.text:
To take part in this Mindfulness Course, we ask that you first complete this short pre-course induction. This includes a participant intake form and some important safety information to ensure you get the most out of your experience.

 

It only takes a few minutes, and then you’ll be ready to begin!

 

👉 Please proceed to the next page to get started.

Safety information  

Mindfulness is a safe and beneficial practice for most people, but it’s important to be aware of a few considerations before you begin. 

This Safety Information document provides guidance on how to approach mindfulness in a way that best supports your well-being.

📥 Please download and read the document before continuing with the course.

Participant intake form 

Before starting the course, you please take a moment to complete this Participant intake form. 

This helps us understand your needs and ensures mindfulness is a safe and supportive practice for you. It only takes a few minutes, and your responses will remain confidential.

Hi, I'm Emma Folwell and I’ll be guiding you through this four-week mindfulness course.

I work in the Interdisciplinary Studies team here at Birmingham Newman University, and I'm also accredited mindfulness teacher with the Mindfulness Teachers Association, trained to deliver evidence-based mindfulness practices in a safe and supportive way. 

This course is designed to be flexible and accessible, so you can explore mindfulness at your own pace and see what works for you. 

I hope you find it helpful!
